title: On The Trail With Kamala Harris
description: In an ongoing series, the NPR Politics Podcast is hitting the road and interviewing 2020 Democratic presidential candidates. In this episode, Scott Detrow and Iowa Public Radio's Clay Masters sit down with Democratic Sen. Kamala Harris to ask about why she's the best pick for president. This series is produced in collaboration with NHPR and Iowa Public Radio.
copyright: Copyright 2015-2021 NPR - For Personal Use Only
itunes:title: On The Trail With Kamala Harris
itunes:author: NPR
itunes:summary: Kamala Harris told the NPR Politics Podcast that if she defeated President Trump in 2020, prosecutors in her Justice Department "should" pursue obstruction of justice charges.
itunes:subtitle: Kamala Harris told the NPR Politics Podcast that if she defeated President Trump in 2020, prosecutors in her Justice Department "should" pursue obstruction of justice charges.
